abstract.text: Asynchronously creates a specialized shader function.

inlineContent.text: The name of the specialized function.
The set of constant values assigned to the function constants. Compilation fails if you don’t provide valid constant values for all required function constants.
A block of code that Metal calls after it creates the specialized function.
An error object that describes compilation problems, if any. This object contains compiler errors if the specialized function is
, and compiler warnings if Metal created the specialized function with warnings. If Metal created the function without errors or warnings, this error object is

Function constant values are first looked up by their index, then by their name. Metal ignores any values that don’t correspond to a function constant in the named function without generating errors or warnings.

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
An object that represents a public shader function in a Metal library.
A set of constant values that specialize a graphics or compute function.
A collection of Metal shader functions.
Synchronously creates an object representing a shader function, using the specified descriptor.
Asynchronously creates an object representing a shader function, using the specified descriptor.
Creates an object that represents a shader function in the library.
Synchronously creates a specialized shader function.
Asynchronously creates a specialized shader function.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
